questions.question_text: Which RBAC role should you assign to the KeyManagers group?

discussion.content:
To fulfill the requirement of allowing users in the Azure AD group named KeyManagers to manage keys for all Azure Cognitive Services, you should assign the following RBAC role to the KeyManagers group:

A. Cognitive Services Contributor

The Cognitive Services Contributor role provides users with the necessary permissions to manage keys and access controls for Azure Cognitive Services. By assigning this role to the KeyManagers group, they will have the ability to manage keys for all Azure Cognitive Services effectively.

Note that the Security Manager, Cognitive Services User, and Security Administrator roles do not specifically grant the required permissions for managing keys in Azure Cognitive Services. The Cognitive Services Contributor role aligns with the specific requirement stated in the question.
